==Events==
<!--Do NOT add videogames, videogame consoles, movie, or album releases, as they WILL be deleted-->
*[[46 BC]] &ndash; [[Julius Caesar]] dedicates a [[temple]] to his mythical ancestor [[Venus (mythology)|Venus Genetrix]] in accordance with a vow he made at the [[battle of Pharsalus]].
* [[715]] &ndash; [[Ragenfrid]] defeats [[Theudoald]] at the [[Battle of Compiègne]].
*[[1087]] &ndash; [[William II of England|William II]] is crowned [[King of England]], and reigns until 1100.
*[[1212]] &ndash; [[Golden Bull of Sicily]] is issued to confirm the hereditary royal title in [[Bohemia]] for the [[Přemyslid dynasty]].
*[[1345]] &ndash; [[Friso-Hollandic Wars]]: [[Frisians]] defeat [[Holland]] in the [[Battle of Warns]].
*[[1371]] &ndash; [[History of the Serbian–Turkish wars|Serbian–Turkish wars]]: The forces of the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] sultan [[Murad I]]'s lieutenant [[Lala Shahin Pasha|Lala Şâhin Paşa]] and the Serbian army under the command of [[Vukašin Mrnjavčević]] and [[Jovan Uglješa]] clash at the [[Battle of Maritsa]].
*[[1493]] &ndash; [[Pope Alexander VI]] issues the [[papal bull]] ''[[Dudum siquidem]]'' to the [[Catholic Monarchs]], extending the grant of new lands he made them in ''[[Inter caetera]]''
*[[1580]] &ndash; [[Sir]] [[Francis Drake]] finishes his circumnavigation of the Earth.
*[[1687]] &ndash; The [[Parthenon]] in [[Athens]] is partially destroyed by an explosion caused by the bombing from [[Republic of Venice|Venetian forces]] led by [[Francesco Morosini|Morosini]] who are besieging the [[Ottoman Turks]] stationed in [[Athens]].
*  1687   &ndash; The city council of [[Amsterdam]] votes to support [[William III of England|William of Orange]]'s invasion of [[England]], which became the [[Glorious Revolution]].
*[[1777]] &ndash; [[Great Britain|British]] troops [[Philadelphia campaign|occupy]] [[Philadelphia, Pennsylvania]] during the [[American Revolution]].
*[[1786]] &ndash; Protestors shut down the court in [[Springfield, Massachusetts]] in a military standoff that begins [[Shays' Rebellion]].
*[[1789]] &ndash; [[Thomas Jefferson]] is appointed the first [[United States Secretary of State]], [[John Jay]] is appointed the first [[United States Supreme Court/Chief Justice|Chief Justice of the United States]], [[Samuel Osgood]] is appointed the first [[United States Postmaster General]], and [[Edmund Randolph]] is appointed the first [[United States Attorney General]].
*[[1792]] &ndash; Marc-David Lasource begins accusing [[Maximilien Robespierre]] of wanting a [[dictatorship]] for [[France]].
*[[1810]] &ndash; A new [[Swedish Act of Succession|Act of Succession]] is adopted by the [[Riksdag of the Estates]] and [[Charles XIV of Sweden|Jean Baptiste Bernadotte]] becomes heir to the [[Sweden|Swedish]] throne.
*[[1872]] &ndash; The first [[Shriners]] Temple (called Mecca) is established in [[New York City]].
*[[1907]] &ndash; [[New Zealand]] and [[Dominion of Newfoundland|Newfoundland]] each become [[dominion]]s within the [[British Empire]].
*[[1908]] &ndash; the Norwegian football club [[SK Brann]] was founded.
*[[1910]] &ndash; Indian journalist [[Swadeshabhimani Ramakrishna Pillai]] is arrested after publishing criticism of the government of [[Travancore]] and exiled.
*[[1914]] &ndash; The [[United States]] [[Federal Trade Commission]] (FTC) is established by the [[Federal Trade Commission Act]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: The [[Battle of Polygon Wood]] begins.
*[[1918]] &ndash; World War I: The [[Meuse-Argonne Offensive]], the bloodiest single battle in American history, begins.
*[[1923]] &ndash; [[Gustav Stresemann]] resumes the Weimar Republic's payment of reparations.
*[[1933]] &ndash; As gangster [[Machine Gun Kelly]] surrenders to the [[FBI]], he shouts out, "Don’t shoot, [[G-Man (slang)|G-Men]]!", which becomes a nickname for FBI agents.
*  1933   &ndash; Ten convicts escape from the [[Indiana State Prison]] with guns smuggled into the prison by bank robber [[John Dillinger]]
*[[1934]] &ndash; [[Steamship]] {{RMS|Queen Mary}} is launched.
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[The Holocaust]]: [[August Frank]], a higher official of the [[SS-Wirtschafts-Verwaltungshauptamt|SS concentration camp administration department]], issues [[August Frank memorandum|a memorandum]] containing a great deal of operational detail in how Jews should be "evacuated".
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Operation Market Garden]] fails.
*  1944   &ndash; World War II: On the [[Gothic Line#Central Front (5th Army)|central front]] of the [[Gothic Line#Battle|Gothic Line]] Brazilian troops control the Serchio valley region after ten days of fighting.
*[[1950]] &ndash; [[United Nations]] troops recapture [[Seoul]] from [[North Korea]]n forces.
*  1950   &ndash; [[Indonesia]] is admitted to the [[United Nations]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Japan]]ese [[train ferry|rail ferry]] ''[[Toya Maru]]'' sinks during a [[typhoon]] in the [[Tsugaru Strait]], [[Japan]] killing 1,172.
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Typhoon Vera]], the strongest typhoon to hit Japan in recorded history, makes landfall, killing 4,580 people and leaving nearly 1.6 million others homeless.
*[[1960]] &ndash; In [[Chicago]], the first [[Television|televised]] [[United States presidential election debates|debate]] takes place between presidential candidates [[Richard M. Nixon]] and [[John F. Kennedy]].
*  1960   &ndash; [[Fidel Castro]] announces Cuba's support for the [[U.S.S.R.]]
* [[1969]] - [[Abbey Road]], the last recorded album by [[The Beatles]], was released.
*[[1970]] &ndash; The [[Laguna Fire]] starts in [[San Diego County]], [[California]], burning {{convert|175,425|acre|km2}}.
*[[1971]] &ndash; The [[Freetown Christiania]] was founded.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Concorde]] makes its first non-stop crossing of the [[Atlantic]] in record-breaking time.
*[[1980]] &ndash; At the [[Oktoberfest terror attack]] in [[Munich]] 13 people died and 211 were injured.
*[[1981]] &ndash; [[Baseball]]: [[Nolan Ryan]] sets a [[Major League Baseball|Major League]] record by throwing his fifth [[no-hitter]].
*[[1983]] &ndash; [[USSR|Soviet]] military officer [[Stanislav Petrov]] averts a likely worldwide nuclear war by [[1983 Soviet nuclear false alarm incident|correctly identifying]] a report of an incoming nuclear missile as a computer error and not an American first strike.
*[[1984]] &ndash; The [[United Kingdom]] agrees to the handover of [[Hong Kong]]
*[[1997]] &ndash; A [[Garuda Indonesia]] [[Airbus A300]] [[Garuda Indonesia Flight 152|crashes]] near [[Medan]], [[Indonesia]], airport, killing 234.
*  1997   &ndash; An [[1997 Umbria and Marche earthquake|earthquake]] strikes the [[Italy|Italian]] regions of [[Umbria]] and the [[Marche]], causing part of the [[Basilica of San Francesco d'Assisi|Basilica of St. Francis at Assisi]] to collapse.
*[[2000]] &ndash; [[Anti-globalization]] protests in [[Prague]] (some 20,000 protesters) turn violent during the [[IMF]] and [[World Bank]] summits.
*  2000   &ndash; The {{MS|Express Samina}} sinks off [[Paros]] in the [[Aegean sea]] killing 80 passengers.
*[[2002]] &ndash; The overcrowded [[Senegal]]ese [[ferry]] {{MV|Le Joola}} capsizes off the coast of [[the Gambia]] killing more than 1,000.
*[[2008]] &ndash; Swiss pilot and inventor [[Yves Rossy]] becomes first person to fly a [[Jet pack#Yves Rossy's jet wingpack|jet engine-powered wing]] across the [[English Channel]].
*[[2009]] &ndash; [[Typhoon Ketsana]] hit the [[Philippines]], [[People's Republic of China|China]], [[Vietnam]], [[Cambodia]], [[Laos]] and [[Thailand]], causing 700 fatalities.
